file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-25-00-05 - RUDDER MANUAL AND AUTO SHUTOFF - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RUDDER MANUAL AND AUTO SHUTOFF - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the operational check of the Rudder Autoshutoff Through Speed Trip/Messages and the Rudder Pedal Manual/Auto Shutoff functions. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY RUDDER PEDALS AUTOSHUTOFF AND ALL 27-25-00-700-801-A ♦ RUDDER MANUAL SHUTOFF FUNC- TIONS- OPERATIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-25-00 Page 1 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-25-00-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. RUDDER PEDALS AUTOSHUTOFF AND RUDDER MANUAL SHUTOFF FUNCTIONS- OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to do: • A check of the Rudder System Autoshutoff Logical Circuit, Electrical Hardware, and related EICAS Messages with the two systems on and then with one system on at a time. • A check of the microswitches of the rudder pedals. (2) This task also gives the procedures to do the operational check of the Rudder Pedal Autoshutoff and Rudder Manual Shutoff functions. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH HTS HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP CMM 27-25-00 - FIM 27-22-00/301 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To do the operational check of the manual GSE 075 Rudder Electric Test Set and automatic shutoff of the rudder system E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Cockpit EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 27-25-00 Page 2 of 13 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Energize the aircraft with the External DC Power Supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Make sure that hydraulic systems 1 and 2 are off. (4) Make sure that the RUDDER 1, RUDDER 2, ADC 1, and ADC 2 circuit breakers are closed on the Circuit Breaker Panel. (5) Make sure that the FADEC 1A, FADEC 2A, FADEC 1B, and FADEC 2B circuit breakers are closed on the Circuit Breaker Panel. (6) Make sure that the N2 SIGNAL 1A, N2 SIGNAL 2A, N2 SIGNAL 1B, and N2 SIGNAL 2B circuit breakers are closed on the Circuit Breaker Panel. J. Operationally Check Rudder Pedal Autoshutoff and Rudder Manual Shutoff Functions (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do a check of the rudder EICAS message. Table 501 Steps The EICAS display Comments shows the message(s): . RUDDER SYS 1-2 INOP Make sure that rudder systems . RUD STOP DISAGREE On the Flight Control (a) 1 and 2 are off, on the Flight (only on aircraft equipped Panel, the pushbut- Control Panel. with Rudder Movable Pri- ton lights are on. mary Stop Mechanism) . RUDDER SYS 1-2 INOP Turn on Electric Motor-Driven . RUD STOP DISAGREE (b) Pump 1 (EMDP 1) ( AMM TASK (only on aircraft equipped 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) Turn on Electric Motor-Driven (c) Pump 2 (EMDP 2) ( AMM TASK . RUDDER SYS 1-2 INOP 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL On the Circuit Breaker Panel, . RUD STOP DISAGREE (d) open the RUDDER 1 and RUD- (only on aircraft equipped DER 2 circuit breaker. with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, (e) close the RUDDER 1 and RUD- . RUDDER SYS 1-2 INOP DER 2 circuit breaker. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 27-25-00 Page 3 of 13 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL Table 501 (Continued) Steps The EICAS display Comments shows the message(s): On the Flight Control Panel, push the RUDDER SHUTOFF No rudder message is . The pushbutton (f) SYS 1 and RUDDER SHUTOFF shown lights are off. SYS 2 pushbuttons to turn on rudder systems 1 and 2. On the Flight Control Panel, push the RUDDER SHUTOFF (g) . RUDDER SYS 1 INOP SYS 1 pushbutton to turn off rudder system 1 On the Flight Control Panel, push the RUDDER SHUTOFF No rudder message is (h) SYS 1 pushbutton to turn on shown rudder system 1 (2) Do a check of the rudder autoshutoff through speed trip. Table 502 Steps The EICAS display shows the message(s) . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL . RUD STOP DISAGREE On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the RUDDER 1 (a) (only on aircraft equipped and RUDDER 2 circuit breakers. with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) . RUDDER OVERBOOST . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL On the Maintenance Panel, operate the ADC 1 and . RUD STOP DISAGREE (b) ADC 2 test switches and keep them on. (only on aircraft equipped with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) Keep the ADC 1 and ADC 2 test switches on and . RUDDER SYS 2 INOP (c) close the RUDDER 2 circuit breaker, on the Circuit Breaker Panel. Keep the ADC 1 and ADC 2 test switches on and . RUDDER OVERBOOST push the RUDDER SHUTOFF SYS 1 pushbutton, (d) on the Flight Control Panel, to turn off rudder sys- tem 1. Keep the ADC 1 and ADC 2 test switches on and . RUDDER SYS 2 INOP push the RUDDER SHUTOFF SYS 1 pushbutton, (e) on the Flight Control Panel, to turn on rudder sys- tem 1. Keep the ADC 1 and ADC 2 test switches on and No rudder message is (f) close the RUDDER 1 circuit breaker, on the Circuit shown. Breaker Panel. RUD STOP DISAGREE (g) open the RUDDER 2 circuit breaker, on the Circuit (only on aircraft equipped Breaker Panel. with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) . RUDDER OVERBOOST Keep the ADC 1 and ADC 2 test switches on and . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL push the RUDDER SHUTOFF SYS 2 pushbutton, . RUD STOP DISAGREE (h) on the Flight Control Panel, to turn off rudder sys- (only on aircraft equipped tem 2. with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) Keep the ADC 1 and ADC 2 test switches on and . RUDDER SYS 2 INOP (i) close the RUDDER 2 circuit breaker, on the Circuit Breaker Panel. Keep the ADC 1 and ADC 2 test switches on and No rudder message is push the RUDDER SHUTOFF SYS 2 pushbutton, shown. (j) on the Flight Control Panel, to turn on rudder sys- tem 2. . RUDDER OVERBOOST . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL Keep the ADC 1 and ADC 2 test switches on and . RUD STOP DISAGREE (l) open the RUDDER 1 and RUDDER 2 circuit break- (only on aircraft equipped ers, on the Circuit Breaker Panel. with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) . RUDDER OVERBOOST . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL On the Maintenance Panel, release the ADC 2 and . RUD STOP DISAGREE (m) keep the ADC 1 test switch on. (only on aircraft equipped with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) . RUDDER OVERBOOST . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL On the Maintenance Panel, release the ADC 1 test . RUD STOP DISAGREE (n) switch and operate the ADC 2 test switch only. (only on aircraft equipped with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL . RUD STOP DISAGREE On the Maintenance Panel, release the ADC 2 test (o) (only on aircraft equipped switch. with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) . RUDDER OVERBOOST . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the ADC 1 and . RUD STOP DISAGREE (p) ADC 2 circuit breakers. (only on aircraft equipped with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 27-25-00 Page 5 of 13 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL Table 502 (Continued) Steps The EICAS display shows the message(s) . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL . RUD STOP DISAGREE On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the ADC 1 cir- (q) (only on aircraft equipped cuit breaker. with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) . RUDDER OVERBOOST . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the ADC 1 cir- . RUD STOP DISAGREE (r) cuit breaker. (only on aircraft equipped with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) . RUD HDOV PROT FAIL . RUD STOP DISAGREE On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the ADC 2 cir- (s) (only on aircraft equipped cuit breaker. with Rudder Movable Pri- mary Stop Mechanism) (3) On the Flight Control Panel, push the RUDDER SHUTOFF SYS 1 to turn off rudder system 1 and push RUDDER SHUTOFF SYS 2 to turn off rudder system 2. (4) Turn off the Electric Motor-Driver Pumps 1 and 2 (EMDP 1 and 2) ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (5) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the ADC 1, RUDDER 1, and RUDDER 2 circuit breakers. (6) Make sure that the YAW TRIM circuit breaker is closed on the Circuit Breaker Panel. (7) Make sure that the YAW TRIM indication is in the neutral position, on the EICAS. (8) Install GSE 075. See Figure 502. (9) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the STEER circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. (10) On GSE 075, operate the LED test switch to do a test of the LEDs. (11) Do these procedures as specified in the table of Figure 503. NOTE: • The table of Figure 503 shows the actions related to these columns: STEP, N2 SIGNAL CBs, PEDALS, RUDDER SHUTOFF, and SWITCHES. • The table of Figure 503 shows the results related to these columns: LEDs on/off, EICAS. • When you do steps 1 thru 48 of the table of Figure 503, you must change the actions to get the results specified in the table of Figure 503. • In the “pedals” column: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 27-25-00 Page 6 of 13 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL - Where there is an asterisk (*), move the rudder pedal against the stop and use force to operate the spring-loaded cartridge. - Where there is no asterisk, only keep the rudder pedals against the stop but do not use force for the spring-loaded cartridge operation. Do not remove your foot from the rudder pedal. - The (1P) symbol stands for pilot, the (2P) symbol stands for copilot, and the (X) stands for pilot and copilot. • On the “EICAS” message column: M1 is RUDDER SYS 1-2 INOP caution message. M2 is RUD HDOV PROT FAIL caution message. M3 is RUDDER SYS 2 INOP caution message. • Do steps 1 thru 28 with the hydraulic system depressurized. For aircraft with the Rudder Movable Primary Stop Mechanism installed, the EICAS display will show the RUD STOP DISAGREE caution message. Ignore this message. • Do steps 29 thru 48 with the hydraulic system pressurized ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). • On the LED column, the black mark means that the LED is on. • On the LED column, the white mark means that the LED is off. • On the LED column, from L1 to L5 and from R1 to R5 relates to LH and RH Rudder Position Microswitches. Refer to CMM 27-25-00. (12) If the information on the GSE 075 is different from the information available on Figure 503, correct the problem as shown in the comments column in the tables of figure 305 of FIM 27-22-00/301. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the Flight Control Panel, push the RUDDER SHUTOFF SYS 1 and RUDDER SHUTOFF SYS 2 pushbuttons to turn off rudder systems 1 and 2. (2) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the N2 SIGNAL 1A, N2 SIGNAL 2A, N2 SIGNAL 1B, and N2 SIGNAL 2B circuit breakers. (3) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the STEER circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (4) Release the pressure of the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). (5) Remove GSE 075. (6) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 27-25-00 Page 7 of 13 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
